talk.author: did:plc:66v2guukgmr3uny2zqqolcf7
talk.utter: Blockchain is public so it's already free. Those who want to invest in things can still do so. I'd rather have a digital file that can be traded, which is public to the world, than one that is free and can be copy pasted.

talk.author: did:plc:66v2guukgmr3uny2zqqolcf7
talk.utter: They already save artist work without paying them. I've made more money minting my art than I ever did before. I can reach a larger audience. Everyone can see my art and those with money can invest in it. They can support artists directly with this system. You can still print it or download it.

talk.author: did:plc:66v2guukgmr3uny2zqqolcf7
talk.utter: No, I made artwork and minted it to NFTs, and people in the community bought it at reasonable amounts to support me as an artist. It literally put food on my table and helped me pay rent. I'm not a wealthy person. I didn't make a lot of money. I just got supported. All artists should do this.

talk.author: did:plc:hh2t22q3cdwixswsiahjlb3b

talk.author: did:plc:66v2guukgmr3uny2zqqolcf7
talk.utter: You can share art all you want. I don't require anyone to invest in my work and I ensure they can all see it and download it. The point is allowing people to invest in me in a way that also allows them to grow value in their investment. It's just like stocks, but with people and artists. It's great.
